column5: Hey guys and gals! Just wanted to know if there is any good creeks or rivers in Burlington to fish for Steelies? I know Bronte is there but wondering if there any other area's that have proven to have bows and browns in them.

only way to know forsure is go and take a look for urself. lots of construction and developments, as well as industrial aspects, have taken its toll on a lot of rivers and streams. good luck on ur search!
Check in the Guide to Eating Fish in Ontario. It lists streams like Grindstone Creek etc that flow into Coote's Paradise. See what fish are listed for the streams that you know about.
I think you'd have the best luck in Bronte creek.  There's a few nice stretches just to the north of Burlington.
Go north towards Milton, there is Lake Kelso and some streams in that area.
